body:
### Option Pricing with Python 

Fame isn't all  
***

The Black-Sholes-Merton model is very popular but that model isn't actually being used by options traders . In fact,  they mostly use a heuristically derived pricing formula which is then adapted by varying the standard deviation of a Gaussian. 
Studying the in and outs of the Black Scholes Model isn't without interest though . 

European Vanilla Calls and Puts
***
The Black Sholes formula is mainly applied for the pricing of European Vanilla Calls and Puts.
The price of a European Vanilla Call, C(S,t) is going to be described below.
S being the underlying asset , K the strike price, r the risk-free rate, T the time to maturity, and  
sigma the constant volatility of the underlying asset.
      

            C(S,t) = SN(d_1) - Ke^{-rT} N(d_2)
d1 and d2 being by :
```

```


### Authors and Contributors
